com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface TopologyNode

public interface TopologyNode

Represents a single node in a topology tree.

Since:
5.5.5

Method Detail

createNode

<N extends TopologyNode> N createNode(java.lang.String name)
Creates a new node as a child of the current node. The node is automatically added to the list of nodes.

Parameters:
name - The name of the new node.
Returns:
The newly created node.

createValue

<V extends TopologyValue> V createValue(java.lang.String name)
Creates a new value element as a child of the current node. The value is automatically added to the list of values.

Parameters:
name - The name of the new value.
Returns:
The newly created value.

getName

java.lang.String getName()
The name of this node.

Returns:
the name of this node.

getNodeFrequency

long getNodeFrequency()
Returns the sample rate set for this node. If no rate has been set, 0 will be returned and the node will inherit its sample rate from its parent.

Returns:
the sample rate for this node, or 0 if not rate has been defined.

getNodeTimestamp

long getNodeTimestamp()
Returns the timestamp associated with this node, or 0 if this node does not have its own timestamp, but instead inherits that of its parent.

Returns:
the timestamp for this node, or 0 if the node inherits its timestamp.

isIdentity

boolean isIdentity()
Whether or not this node or value represents an identity property.

Returns:
true if this node of value represents an identity property and false if it does not.

isReplace

boolean isReplace()
Whether or not the current node will replace (true) or append to (false, default) existing values in the server.

Returns:
true if the value will replace any existing and false if it will not.
Since:
5.5.5.1

setId

void setId(java.lang.String id)
           throws InvalidTopologyException
Sets the (free-form) ID for this node. This ID, used in conjunction with setRefId(String) can be used to reduce the size of the tree that is transmitted to the upstream server.

This will increase the complexity of your code and is not recommended unless you are frequently submitting large topology trees. "frequently" and "large" will vary depending on the host and load from other agents.

You may set an ID, or a reference ID for this node, but not both.

Parameters:
id - The identifier to be used for this node.
Throws:
InvalidTopologyException - if a reference ID has already been set for this node.

setIsIdentity

void setIsIdentity(boolean is_identity)
Provides a hint to the server side processing code that this node represents an identity property in the topology types definition.

Nodes and values that represent identity properties will be submitted to the CDT by the FglAM server-side code every time they are encountered in the topology. Nodes and values that are not marked as identity will only be submitted to the CDT the first time they are encountered.

Parameters:
is_identity - whether or not this node represents an identity property.

setNodeFrequency

void setNodeFrequency(long frequency)
Sets the rate which will be reported to the server. If no rate is defined for this node, then the rate is inherited from its parent.

Parameters:
frequency - The sample collection rate that will be reported to the server. This value is in milliseconds. Use zero to indicate data submitted out-of-band. That is, not at the regularly scheduled interval.

setNodeTimestamp

void setNodeTimestamp(long timestamp)
Sets the timestamp associated with this node and any child nodes or values that do not have a timestamp of their own.

Parameters:
timestamp - The timestamp for this node, in milliseconds since the Epoch. This must be in local machine time and will be adjusted to compensate for time drift between the client and the server.

setRefId

void setRefId(java.lang.String refid)
              throws InvalidTopologyException
Sets the (free-form) reference ID for this node. When the server encounters a node with a reference ID set, it will look up that ID and submit the data in the node with the provided ID instead. The referenced node must have been submitted prior to this node in the same sample.

This will increase the complexity of your code and is not recommended unless you are frequently submitting large topology trees. "frequently" and "large" will vary depending on the host and load from other agents.

You may set an ID, or a reference ID for this node, but not both.

Parameters:
refid - The ID of the node that the server should process instead of this node.
Throws:
InvalidTopologyException - if an ID has already been set for this node.

setReplace

void setReplace(boolean replace)
For topology attributes that are marked as "is-many", setting replace to true will cause the server to replace any existing values with those contained in the current data submission. The default (false) is to append to the existing list.

Please be aware that setting replace to true for many data submissions will result in quite significant topology churn, and should be avoided unless absolutely necessary. For topology attributes that change moderately frequently, please consider using observations instead.

A good example of a topology attribute for which you would want to replace an existing list would be the list of mounted files systems on a host. This does not change very often and when it does, there is no reason to retain the old values in the current data view.

Parameters:
replace - Whether or not the value should replace (true) or append to (false, default) the existing values in the server.
Since:
5.5.5.1

setTypeHint

void setTypeHint(java.lang.String type)
Sets a hint as to the type of topology object represented by this node. When the server processes the node, it will push an extra node with the provided type as its name. The CDT associated with the agent should be adjusted to handle this extra node and node information.

This will increase the complexity of your code and is not recommended unless you are frequently submitting large topology trees. "frequently" and "large" will vary depending on the host and load from other agents.

Parameters:
type - The type hint to provide to the server.
